ratings.comment: I love his accent; it reminds me of Dr. Zoidberg from Futurama. I also love how passionate he is about Math. It makes learning the material an interesting and worthwhile endeavor. Occasionally, he would teach in a sort of unorganized or circuitous manner, but it was obvious he knew the material very well.

Great professor, very clear in lecture. He's brilliant so sometimes he moves quickly.  Midterms are very difficult but manageable and the curve is very generous. I would highly recommend him for 222. Awesome guy.

Love love loved him. he made everything clear in lecture and then tested us on what we were taught. no surprises on tests. tests weren't too hard and his curve is super generous. He's really funny too so lectures aren't torture. I went to his office hours too and he was very helpful and welcoming. He makes 222 a lot better than what's expected.
He was a very good professor. He spoke very clearly and explained concepts very well. He does a good job of explaining exactly what you need to know for exams and then grades very fairly.

Overall a good professor. He explains concepts well and makes some jokes during lectures. Sometimes he goes too much into proofs which becomes boring. I wish he showed more examples and worked them out instead of doing mainly proofs and concepts. Homework can be really long sometimes, but it's doable. Exams are not too bad and are usually curved.

I absolutely loved having this guy. I thought he was hilarious and related his math to things in everyday life to make it more interesting. It was very difficult to do well on tests, however. Although the questions were very fair, the tiny amount of points involved made even a small mistake a large blow to your grade.

Professor Milewski is a great lecturer and teacher.  The content can be challenging, but he does a good job of explaining things - much better than the book, so definitely attend lecture.  Takes a long time to grade exams but is generally fair.

One of the better professors at the university. He speaks clearly, and is sometimes funny. I enjoyed having him for a professor. And the hardness rating is kinda high only because it's the difficulty of the course. In general, he is a lenient grader compared to my other professors.

Lecture was great. His lectures were well put together and well thought out. Examples were instructive and well-chosen. Homework load was doable and he was very helpful and approachable. I wish I would have gone to office hours earlier!!!!

I had Prof. Milewski for Honors Thesis.  Great professor, always helpful.  I'm not sure how effective he is for lecture, since I never had him for that, but if you ever want to do research for him and he agrees, you should definitely take advantage of it!  You will learn a lot!

One of the best professors I have had so far.  He is charismatic, funny, and also a very good teacher. His exams were fair, curved, and pretty easy by most standards. He was very approachable and wanted students to do well.

Very good professor! Explains everything in perfect detail, motivates problems and concepts, does lots of practice examples in class and has a cool sense of humor! Also a very good artist (being able to draw/visualize in 3D helps a lot for this class). Exams are very fair and curved if they're hard. I'd recommend anyone to try and get him for 234.

One of the best math professors I have ever had. Challenging, interesting and understands the problems you might have from a students point of view. Really puts things into perspective that I can actually learn from unlike  just going by the book. Can't say enough about him.

I thought Prof. Milewski was a great teacher.  He really knows his stuff, and you can tell that he really loves math.  He's also pretty funny, which makes the power lecture go by easier.  His tests aren't bad, and they're curved.  Try and take him for 234 if you can.

I don't understand why people like him so much. He rambles on in class and only seems to care about proving everything. He thinks he's really funny and makes crude comments occasionally that have nothing to do with the lecture. I'd highly reccommend a different professor for this class. The only way I learned was by reading the book! F-
a very funny and nice guy. he's explains concepts very well. his tests are a little long, but are decent. do the homework and go to lecture.
very fun, his humor alone made class worth going to. the helpfulness of his lectures is as good as youd expect from any math teacher. exams are OK

He's a pretty enjoyable professor; obviously enjoys what he does. However, his exams are extremely tough (half my calc class failed the first one... After the curve). Also, the week before my final he was out of town and wasn't there to help in office hours. Missed 2 weeks of class.

This guys is awesome. His humor made the class very entertaining. He always uses examples to help students understand difficult concepts and explains everything graphically. If you enjoy physically and geometrically based calculus you will love Milewski.
Entertaining, tries to make it fun and succeeds most of the time. However, tests very difficult, even though I took calc in h.s. (perhaps b/c I didn't study much, idk)
Good prof, tries to make lecture interesting, funny.  Presents subject clearly.  Tests are very tough but he curves them.
Very fun; tough tests though
makes people enjoy the world of mathematics
Good professor.  Did lots of examples, took questions, funny.  The class was hard, but it was calculus.
good, funny professor; tests were not that difficult
No Comments
take him if you've already taken calculus in high school, not much homework, good professor
he was pretty good, but the class was pretty hard.
i thought he was pretty good and i'm taking him again for 222
